Package io.zbox.zboxfs

ZboxFS is a zero-details, privacy-focused in-app file system.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DirEntry
    Entries returned by the Repo.readDir(String) function.
    Env
    This class is to initialise ZboxFS environment.
    File
    A reference to an opened file in the repository.
    Metadata
    Metadata information about a regular file or a directory.
    OpenOptions
    Options and flags which can be used to configure how a file is opened.
    Repo
    The Repo class represents an encrypted repository containing the whole file system.
    RepoInfo
    Information about a repository.
    RepoOpener
    A builder used to create a repository in various manners.
    Version
    A representation of a permanent file content.
    VersionReader
    A reader for a specific version of file content.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Cipher
    Crypto cipher primitives.
    FileType
    This class represents a type of file, that is, a regular file or a directory.
    MemLimit
    Password hash memory limit.
    OpsLimit
    Password hash operation limit.
    SeekFrom
    Enumeration of possible methods to seek within a file or version reader.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ZboxException
    Exception to indicate that there is an error happened during operations in ZboxFS.

Package io.zbox.zboxfs Description

ZboxFS is a zero-details, privacy-focused in-app file system.

Its goal is to keep your app files securely, privately and reliably on underlying storage. By encapsulating files and directories into an encrypted repository, it provides a virtual file system and exclusive access to the authorised application.

The most core parts of this module are Repo and File, which provides most API for file system operations and file data I/O.

  • Repo provides file system manipulation methods, such as openFile, createDir and etc.
  • File provides file I/O methods, such as read, write, seek and etc.

Env.init(java.lang.String) initialises the environment and should be called once before any other methods provided by ZboxFS.

After repository is opened by RepoOpener, all of the other functions provided by ZboxFS will be thread-safe.
